isis.stitle: DIAMONDLIFE™ (BOSCH PIN SLIDE) DISC BRAKES For Vehicles Built Before June 3, 2002 - disassemble - ANCHOR PLATE AND SPLASH SHIELD

svcsubproc.title: Disassembly of Anchor Plate Components

note.para:
Several changes have been incorporated within the anchor plate assembly and caliper mounting bolts on vehicles manufactured after June 3, 2002. It is important to recognize that these changes are not found on disc brakes on vehicles manufactured before June 3, 2002, unless a complete rebuild of the anchor plate assembly was performed on the vehicle. The components that have changed are the leading and trailing guide pins (Figure 67)
and (Figure 68)
and caliper mounting bolts (Figure 71) .

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 41
for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para:
With the anchor plate and splash shield (Items 1 and 2) removed and placed on a clean work surface, remove guide pins and guide pin boots (Items 4 and 5) by pulling guide pin out of anchor plate (Item 1) with a slight twisting motion. The guide pin boot (Item 3, Figure 42)
will pull off the anchor plate boot groove (Item 4, Figure 42) . Remove guide pin boots from guide pins.

If the heads of guide pins (Item 4) are the same (Figure 67) , the vehicle was manufactured before June 3, 2002. You can tell the old guide pins from the new guide pins by looking at the head of the guide pins. The old guide pin heads will look the same, the new trailing guide pin head will have a notch on each side of the rounded sides of the head. If the old guide pins are found, it is recommended that new leading and trailing guide pins (Figure 68)
used on disc brake assemblies of vehicles manufactured after June 3, 2002 be installed during rebuilding of anchor plate.
Remove brake pad abutment slippers (Item 6) using a blunt nose drift or screwdriver and a light hammer. Avoid marring anchor plate abutment surfaces of anchor plate (Item 1).
On front and rear axles with 66 mm disc brakes, remove 12-point head bolt plugs (Item 3) from anchor plate tie bar mounting holes of the anchor plate (Item 1).

Once the 12-point head bolt plugs (Item 3), guide pins and guide pin boots (Items 4 and 5) and brake pad abutment slippers (Item 6) have been removed from the anchor plate (Item 1), clean all road contamination from the exterior of anchor plate and splash shield with a wire brush and solvent.

figure.caption: Figure 41. Disassembly Of Anchor Plate Components
Figure 42. Remove Guide Pins and Guide Pin Boots from Anchor Plate

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 43 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If so equipped, remove ABS sensor bracket (Item 1) from anchor plate (Item 2) by removing two 12-point head bolts (Item 3), driver side front and rear shown.
Remove splash shield (Item 4) from anchor plate (Item 2) by removing three 12-point head bolts (Item 5), driver side front and rear shown.

Once the ABS sensor bracket (Item 1) and splash shield (Item 4) have been removed from the anchor plate (Item 2), clean all road contamination from the exterior of anchor plate and splash shield and ABS sensor bracket with a wire brush and solvent.

figure.caption: Figure 43. Remove ABS Sensor Bracket and Splash Shield from Anchor Plate

step1.para:
Once the anchor plate and splash shield has been disassembled, refer to ANCHOR PLATE AND SPLASH SHIELD, Clean and Inspect
to clean and inspect and rebuild the anchor plate and splash shield.
